moves.3... e6: Black do not try to defend the pawn, prefering to carry on with the sicilian
moves.6... e5 7. Nxc6 bxc6: Good for black, they get the b open file which will be easy to control
moves.9. Qd2:
a bit dangerous but I do that more and more often, for it frees the DSB for other goals
White can castle both sides
moves.9... Bb7: 2 unprotected knights. Rb8 would have been better
moves.11. O-O Bxc3 12. bxc3: White will control the open b file and his two bishops on the center are very dangerous.
moves.12... Nf6: to permit the castle but also permitting white attack on the queens wing
moves.14... Qc8 15. Rb3: To double the rooks on the open file
moves.16... d6 17. Rab1: Rooks doubled ! Now whites plan is to bring the queen on d6
moves.17... Bc6 18. c3: To enable the bishop to go on c2 so that the queen can attack d6
moves.22. Qxg7: The black king is unsafe,  which compensate a bit the late of material
moves.26. Bf5 Qe7 27. Qd2+ Kc7: The black king refugees between two open files
moves.28. Reb1 Rhb8 29. Qb2: Double tower and queen on open file, nothing's more dangerous
moves.31. Bxd7: To enable Qxb6. or Qb1, leading to a draw
moves.33... Kd6 34. Qb6: Black should have plaid the draw. Now he is running into trouble
moves.35... Ke7 36. Qxc5+: check and black has only one move if he wants not to loose his queen
moves.36... Ke8 37. Rd6: Black looses queen or bishop and rook
